Reviews.Title: Right price for a BIG TV
Reviews.Author: Big Mike
Reviews.Content: I purchased this from walmart on Black Friday online. So far I have been very happy with it. The sound is fine in my opinion and the picture is good for a 50" 60hz TV. While obviously samsung and other big names have better quality TVs, for $430 for 50" this is a great deal.I cared more about having a big tv then a super high quality picture when I purchased this. The picture is still good, you just need to make sure you don't sit super close. My couch is about 8ft away from the TV and the picture is great.

Reviews.Title: sceptre 50 inch
Reviews.Author: shannon_g8er
Reviews.Content: Ive had this tv for about 2 weeks. This tv is good for the price and has a good picture however the sound really is pretty bad you will want external speakers.  It sounds like my laptop.  Otherwise happy so far.

Reviews.Title: It's been 10months and I'm still happy
Reviews.Author: dione "son"
Reviews.Content: I bought this on black Friday from Walmart 2012. Here it is sept 2013 and not one issue. I'm definitely glad I purchased this tv. The picture is decent and the sound is good too. Hope this helps someone decide.

Reviews.Title: Why more?
Reviews.Author: Violet's Mom
Reviews.Content: Sceptre was founded in 1984 in California. The company is specified toward electronic products like TV and monitors then bloated companies like Samsung and Sony. I had already owned a Sceptre monitor of great quality that displayed even high end PC gaming extremely well. This 50 inch Sceptre TV is an amazing product at an amazing price. A full 1080p at 60hz TV. I use the TV for PC and console gaming. Please note that the human eye struggles to see the difference between 60hz and 120hz also that smart tv is pointless if you have a modern blu ray player, pc or gaming console. TV has 3 hdmi which is plenty, USB, to audio types one for PC, VGA for PC, composite, component and lastly cable. I don't have tv however so I can't give any feedback on that. This TV works wonder full for using the VGA for PC display. I tried HDMI for my PC, but in my personal opinion VGA outputs better picture quality and HDMI failed to fit the screen correctly. I see no loss in quality from games like Batman Arkham City with Extreme settings on PC compared to the asus vs239h-p monitor. I have a 5760x1080 eyefinity display with three of those monitors and I personally find this Sceptre 50 inch TV to be a more immersive experience. Not to mention 5760x1080 puts more strain on my gpu and ultimately I just don't like the stretched out side viewing of the side monitors. Maybe it makes sense for FPS titiles, but it makes no sense for 3rd person perspective. Their should be no image stretching in my opinion. Lastly, this tv is set at power saving, and vivid isn't that good either. Jack the contrast, color and sharpenss up into the 70-90's for best image quality. Extremely satisfied with this TV.I forgot to say the speakers are horrible, but I will not judge a flat-screen tv on it's sound. Both flat screen tv's and monitor's are not meant to have good sound. I have 17 year old speaker system that works wonderfully. So I'm assuming anyone who's buying a tv has a speaker set up ready for use.

Reviews.Title: Tv stand broke
Reviews.Author: hbrown
Reviews.Content: Wife came home and found our tv on the floor and the stand was still on the piece of furniture.  The tv just broke off the stand. I think the screws that were provided were too short.Other than that it has been a great tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: Picture OK, but remote hard to use
Reviews.Author: T. Anders
Reviews.Content: The picture and sound quality seemed to be fine, however, the remote control and on screen menu were very complicated.  The remote would only work while standing very close to TV and pointing exactly at the area of the sensor.  Who wants to mess with that while relaxing on couch to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: GIves you bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Eizenh3im
Reviews.Content: I have always been skeptical about buying cheap products and usually go for expensive one. I made an exception in this case and went for this super cheap tv. The video quality is really good. I have had friends come over and see the tv and none of them could believe that this tv was being offered so cheap. The audio is ok. I would have bought speakers anyways, so this was not an issue. Having said that, I have been using them without speakers since the last 2 weeks and the audio is not that bad. It is definitely ok for day to da tv shows, etc. But, not great for movies/music.Point to note: This tv does not have an optical out for audio, unlike most modern tvs. So, either you ll have to buy speakers which support analog input or spend some money on a converter.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: William L. Porter
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a week now with no complaints. Sound was not so good at first, but I found that turning off the Digital Audio Output under menu/sound/other settings greatly improved the sound from the on-board speakers. Standard definition TV picture is acceptable, but HD with HDMI cable is brilliant. As with sound, you can adjust the picture to your room/tastes. For under $500 you can not go wrong.

Reviews.Content: The TV is okay in that you have a decent (not great) picture quality.  But the real issue is the sound quality.  The sound is poor and if we didn't have the TV connected to the surround sound system, it would have been sent back.

Reviews.Content: Super Duper Nice Especially for the price!!! Its not the sharpest most vivid in the worl. But its Nice its HD. And best of all its Sub $500 for a 50"!!!

With that said, within the first few minutes of the call to Amazon the replacement order was already on its way. Installation was easy, Picture is good.  I can't really speak to the level of qualify except that it is perfectly fine for us.Good TV, Great PriceEasy logistics.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: BidEuphoria, Inc.
Reviews.Content: Love my new tv, its easy to set up, and great picture quality, just love it. Makes my room feel much more like a home now. Thanks Amazon and Sceptre

Reviews.Title: Customer service is GREAT
Reviews.Author: phil tharaldson
Reviews.Content: Purchased a Sceptre TV 6 months ago. We did have a failure, a complete failure, here is why I gave a 5 star rating. I contacted Sceptre and because the TV is 40 inches or larger they sent a repair man from our area, (we live rural minnesota) came from 70 miles away. Sceptre contacted us every step of the way, as did the repair company. The customer service is GREAT. The TV works perfectly, we have a Bose radio we run the sound with, the stand mounted just fine, no other problems. In todays world you may have problems, it is how they are resolved. THANK YOU SCEPTRE!!!

Reviews.Title: Good flat screen for the money.
Reviews.Author: SKT376 Auctions
Reviews.Content: I purchased this online with some hesitance as I generally need to see the picture in person first. It arrived in it's factory box which seems to provide adequate protection. Setup is simple and the controls are simple as well. The remote is designed with a generally well thought out layout. The speakers are a tad anemic but there is a built in equalizer which helps with this shortcoming. The volume is more than adequate. The picture using HDTV over the air is excellent. SDTV is ok but up close become obviously pixelated. I connected a DVD player with component input but the picture can get VERY black in dark scenes and adjustment is necessary. I think using a player with an HDMI output will work better. The screen and bezel are nice looking and I like that the "Septre" logo is not backlit as are so many other sets on the market. Overall this a  great set for general TV watching.

I only had one issue with it, and it was easily resolved... issue was the sound,,, a sound bar fixed the problem... so I really do recommend this tv because of the picture being so clear, others had reported sound problems as well. I did not have any problems with the remote, very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound.

If it gets too loud, the sound starts to distort.  I am glad to have found this TV, I knew it would be good because I bought a Sceptre computer monitor a few years ago and it was awesome. Reviews.Title: Great TV for such a low price
Reviews.Author: John Beena
Reviews.Content: Pros.: Hi folks. Don't let the no name-brand turn you off. This is a great TV for the price ($399). The remote control has many useful features that saves time sifting through the on screen menu while watching TV. I love the "Aspect" button to make partial screen broadcasts into full screen (Cinema) on the TV with a one push of the button. Also, the "Sleep" button is very useful. The sleep feature was not even listed in the specs. The QAM tuner allows watching all unscrambled digital and analog channels without a Set-top box. Picture is sharp and the internal speakers are clear, nice and loud. I don't understand why there are so many unfavorable comments about the sound. My most favorite feature is the "Favorite" channels buttons on the remote (No pun intended), which also was not listed in the specs. The four favorite selection buttons on the remote makes it a breeze to select and access your favorite channels.I bought a 46" Samsung smart TV two weeks ago for $200 more than I paid for this TV. Samsung customer service in India were terrible. I am so glad I returned Samsung and bought this TV. I discovered that I don't need/want the Smart feature for internet access on a TV.  It was so slow and froze so much, it was crazy. A computer is much better access to internet. This TV has a MHL connection for a Roku stick if you want internet access. The old adage that a higher priced item is not necessarily better; holds true with this TV. The package even includes a screw driver and a soft cloth to clean the screen. Not that I needed a screw driver, but it's a sign how detailed oriented Sceptre company is.Cons.: The USB connection cannot play a movie (motion picture). It can only display a picture from a USB thumb drive. The CC (Closed Caption) setup options are either On or Off. There is no option to automatically activate on mute only and disappear when un-muted.

I tried contacting customer service on 3 occasions but nobody answered the phone.  I left an email message, hopefully someone will get back to me.

So if you want a "50 for $500, then this is the TV for you!

Reviews.Title: 5 Stars despite the speaker
Reviews.Author: Mike5Coat
Reviews.Content: I have never heard of this company before, but when I saw it was by far the least expensive 50", I did a little research on it and apparently the only complaints are with the speakers, which are crap (they're great for TV and comedy movies, but obviously don't deliver for games and action flicks). That really is the only downside against this tv, which I don't even hold against it since it has an audio out and I have a boss sound system.The picture quality is amazing. 50,000:1 DCR ain't bad. It gives deep blacks and true whites. The picture presets look like they can be changed, but when you try to, it just saves that setting in the one user slot you're allowed, so I usually keep it on power saver unless I roar up my XBOX. There are a couple of energy star features on the extras menu as well, but only turn on "no signal power off" unless you have cable hooked up (just a side note).Although the sound isn't great, there are pretty good equalizers that pump a little more sound and make it less awful. There was also a note about the remote having terrible range. Their batteries might have been dead because it works all the way across the room. I hope to get a wall mount soon, but the pivoting base is plenty sturdy and reinforced.The rests of the features speak for themselves, but I would definitely grab this tv again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Content: Great price, great picture, great sound, easy to operate. I'm no techy, so maybe I wouldn't know if something was lacking, but it is great for me.

I've only had it a little over a week but so far so good.  Don't know what else of write here since I am not an expert of TVs.  Just know if they work right or not

Reviews.Title: Most features for the money
Reviews.Author: P.G. Bowden "Omegaman"
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying the only HDTV's I've ever owned are Sceptres. So I can't compare it to the name brand HD sets as to picture quality. But I have been completely satisfied with all the Sceptres I've owned.I bought this 50" set because of the reasonable price and 2 main features--namely that it offers RCA stereo audio outputs and 3 HDMI ports.It amazes me that most brands don't realize that many customers still use analog audio theater systems and have no desire to purchase a digital converter box. RCA audio outs is a simple feature to add to a TV but in my experience only Sceptre and the Vizio "a-I" series offer it. (I'm sure there are others--I just didn't see them) So this set saved me $25 right off the bat (no need for digital converter and cord).I currently only use 2 of the 3 HD ports but it's nice to have the 3rd if I need it--many sets cost hundreds more and have only 2 ports. It also has both component and composite inputs for 2 more devices. C'mon now, how many sets offer all these inputs and outputs?I will echo what one reviewer said about the threading of the screws--my base is being held by 4 of the 5 because one screw was impossible to turn. And it took muscle to thread 3 of the other 4. Sceptre, you can do better than this.Also, while the glossy black bevel is quite beautiful, be aware that it will reflect light like glass. It can be a distraction.I believe most picture settings on TV's are on "power saving" out of the box--all you have to do is switch to "user" and you can configure it the way you want. There are also several preset picture modes that are all better than power saving. I use "power saving" for sports talk or politics to be "green" and save a little money, and "user" for games and movies and sci-fi docs.That's about it. I haven't had an ounce of trouble (aside from screw mis-threading) with any of the Sceptres I've owned. And just to fill you in (since this website doesn't), the dynamic contrast on this set is 50,000. Got it from the user manual. It can't touch LG, Samsung or Vizio, but look at it this way, I saw a 2007 article talking about the norm for native contrast (800:1) and dynamic (10,000:1). So this model Sceptre blows away the picture quality of many TV's of just 6 yrs ago.Bottom line--you won't find a TV with all these features for the price. I've only had this one 3 days but I couldn't be happier.
